job_summary:
Dans un souci d’accessibilité et de clarté, l’écriture inclusive n’est pas utilisée dans cette annonce. Les termes employés au masculin se réfèrent aussi bien au genre féminin que masculin.

 Vos connaissances disent souvent que vous êtes au fait des dernières innovations ? Votre entourage est étonné par votre capacité à apprendre toujours plus ? Vous portez une attention particulière à votre bien-être notamment dans votre environnement de travail et vous souhaitez vous engager pour impacter la société ? Vous pensez que travailler dans un environnement agile, flexible et accessible permet à toutes et à tous d’innover ensemble ?

 Rejoignez Accenture et participez à changer le monde.
 En cette période particulière, nous avons adapté notre processus de recrutement pour que celui-ci se fasse en visio-conférence.

 Au sein d’Accenture Security, vous rejoignez une équipe spécialisée sur les solutions de sécurité native Google Cloud Platform et Chronicle.

 En tant qu’Expert Google Cloud Security quelles seront vos missions ?

 Collaborer avec les équipes d'Accenture pour inclure et intégrer la sécurité dans les grands plans de transformation et de migration cloud Google afin de réduire les risques et de protéger les systèmes, les applications, les données, les processus et les expériences client de nos clients.
 Contribuer à la définition des fondations (sécurité, réseau, identité, gouvernance)
 Préconiser les solutions et architectures cibles et rédiger les dossiers d’architecture
 Veiller à la sécurité et la fiabilité des environnements déployés
 Animer des ateliers techniques avec nos clients pour aider à la prise de décision et à la conclusion de stratégie de transformation cloud avec une portée de sécurité incluse.










Le métier d’Expert Google Cloud Security est fait pour vous si :

 Vous êtes diplômé d’une formation Bac+5 minimum
 Vous disposez de minimum 3 ans d'expérience sur Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
 Vous possédez une expertise sur les solutions de sécurité Google Cloud Platform & Chronicle comme Cloud Security Command Center, Cloud Identity, Chronicle, Cloud Armor, Web Security Scanner, Siemplify, Cloud Logging & Monitoring avec une expérience significative en entreprise (grands groupes de préférence) ;
 Vous êtes certifié Google Professional Cloud Security Engineer


 Vous tirerez également votre épingle du jeu grâce aux éléments suivants :

 Votre aisance relationnelle et rédactionnelle, ainsi qu’un esprit de synthèse et d’analyse
 Vous êtes reconnu pour votre rigueur et votre sens de la méthode ;
 Vous aimez travailler en équipe ;
 Votre disponibilité et réactivité ;
 Votre sens du service et du respect des engagements ;
 De nature curieux.se, vous savez être force de propositions.


 Vous développez votre expertise : Accenture propose des évolutions internes vers de nouvelles responsabilités ou de nouvelles expertises. En rejoignant nos équipes, vous travaillez au quotidien avec des experts du monde entier. Vous maîtrisez une méthodologie performante et progressez grâce à un large panel de formation.

 En tant qu'Architecte Sécurité Cloud, vous rejoignez nos experts Technology pour exploiter la puissance du digital, stimuler l’innovation et améliorer le quotidien de nos clients. Conjuguez expertise business et connaissance des technologies de pointe pour aider nos clients à réinventer leur entreprise, tout en renforçant leur cyber-résilience.

 Notre stratégie « Cloud First » et l’acquisition de Gekko, entreprise française leader des services Amazon Web Services, vous permet par ailleurs de bénéficier d’une expertise novatrice en Cloud et d’accompagner nos clients de bout-en-bout sur leurs différents projets dans ce domaine. L’alliance avec Gekko, mais également avec d’autres acteurs clés tels que Google et Microsoft, vous permet de travailler avec les meilleurs experts du marché sur l’ensemble des technologies Cloud.

 Accenture, c'est une communauté de plus de 600 000 talents et une mission commune réaliser la promesse technologique, alliée à l’ingéniosité humaine.

 Dans un monde en perpétuel changement, nous accélérons la transformation des plus grandes entreprises de la stratégie jusqu’à la mise en œuvre grâce aux technologies de demain et dynamisons leur croissance grâce à l'expertise multi-sectorielle de nos experts !
 Plongez au cœur de l’innovation en rejoignant notre équipe, une équipe qui aspire à créer de la valeur pour ses clients et à faire toujours mieux pour ses talents.
 Envie d’en savoir plus sur le quotidien des collaborateurs Accenture ?
 Posez-leur directement vos questions.
 Envie de devenir acteur ou actrice du changement ? Postulez dès maintenant.

 Lieu de l'offre: Lille

 CDI

JumpWork, recruitment company dedicated to the financial sector, supports private banks, investment banks, asset management companies and family offices in their needs of specialized profiles. True partner of proximity, our team of specialists brings to its candidates its expertise, its network and its time. We are currently looking for a Cyber Security Officer for a major Private Bank based in Monaco.
DUTIES 

Creation and review of daily Privileged Access reports. Investigate ways to improve efficiency of these checks and align to Global Standards where possible.
Review and approval of privileged access requests.
Support the JOC and incident response teams for detected security events. Ensure any issues or risk events related to cyber and information security are recorded in a timely manner and properly escalated to relevant stakeholders. Define relevant action plan and ensure all actions are tracked and completed successfully.
Ensure risks arising from changes and new projects are properly identified, assessed and managed. Provide project support, assurance, remediation support, and guidance to the business. Assist the business with identifying alternate solutions or compensating controls where requirements are not met, or provide guidance for appropriate risk acceptance.
Vulnerability management across Monaco infrastructure, including review of monthly external scans. Ensure any security threat, vulnerability, non-compliance and risk specific to the BU is properly followed-up, escalated and remediated.


Coordination of local security related initiatives (PenTests, Upgrades of security platforms etc.), local delivery of global cyber projects and local remediation of large-scale cyber issues identified by Group security teams.
Maintain and operate supported security toolsets:


Creation and maintenance of accurate, high quality documentation
Maintain Disaster Recovery strategy and coordinate DR testing
Plan and coordinate lifecycle and capacity management
Implement enhancements to service
Incident / Problem / recovery activities
Remediate Audit and Control issues


Review datacenter access reports on a monthly basis.
Oversee physical equipment disposal in line with security policy.
Provide Subject Matter Expertise for all IT security related queries, direction to strategic projects and business initiatives as required, and CSO sign-off when required

Stakeholder Management and Leadership
Interact with stakeholders to resolve technical issues and provide guidance on the toolset reporting.
Work with projects and stakeholders to develop and improve the current and new solutions within the bank.
Coordinate with Service Managers and be able to explain technical problems to a non-technical audience.
Suggest improvements to key stakeholders and provide timely updates to management.
Decision-making and Problem Solving
Problem solving and critical thinking are key skills in this role. Quickly picking up new services and technologies, identifying optimum strategies for resolving issues and using creative thinking in that pursuit
Risk and Control Objective
Ensure that all activities and duties are carried out in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal policies and policy Standards
PROFILE 
The candidate should possess a strong technical delivery background with recent experience of Cyber Security disciplines.
The candidate also has a solid background in Information Security principles and controls and excellent awareness of detect and protect via security systems.
The candidate must possess good communication skills with the ability to work with other teams globally.
Essential Skills/Basic Qualifications:

Strong understanding of the risk based approach, experience with risk analysis
Proven IT security engineer, with good working knowledge of a number of assurance security tool sets; Privileged Access management, Endpoint Protection (DLP, Anti virus), Vulnerability Assessment, Firewall Assurance,
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills, working experience within large and complex projects
Proven working experience of Windows and Linux operating systems.
Experience with scripting / programming languages, Python, PowerShell, Chef, SQL
Ability to lead and support both internal and external audit requirements E.G - ISAE

Desirable skills/Preferred Qualifications:

Solid understanding of networking technologies; switches, routers, firewalls, proxies, IDS, IPS.
Understanding of cloud technologies and automation in a operational environment; AWS, CloudFormation, Azure, GCC
Ability to work in remote teams, set and control own work load
An understanding of DevOps/DevSecOps

We are an equal opportunity employer and we are opposed to discrimination on any grounds. Join us on social networks (Linkedin, Facebook, Twitter). This is the best way to stay updated with our latest offers.
Type d'emploi : Temps plein, CDI

Bonjour, Je suis à la recherche d'un profil Security Manager. Le security manager assure la pertinence et la qualité de la prestation cyber au travers des volets suivants : ✓ Production : o S'assure de l'adéquation entre le terrain et la théorie du contrat o S'assure de la qualité des traitements opérés (suivi des remontées, prise en charge des blocages, points internes hebdo pour l'amélioration de nos process & outils) o Veille à l'amélioration continue de la plateforme (configs appliquées, nouveaux modules activables, Script pour automatisation, points bi-mensuel avec constructeur, etc.) o Veille sécuritaire (qualification des dernières vulnérabilités vis-à-vis des périmètres sous supervision & des attaques récentes / sommes nous les prochains ?) o Point de validation pour le déclenchement d'une crise o Porte d'escalade pour les analystes et pour le client o Hunting sur XDR en best effort (selon dispo) ✓ Gouvernance : o Contact privilégié du RSSI client pour les aspects de Gouvernance, Risques et Conformité Sécurité o Organise et anime un point quotidien en parallèle de chaque évènement sous supervision cyber (COM-OP : Faits marquants / incident de sécurité / etc ) o Organise et anime un point hebdomadaire de revue de l'activité (CO-SUI : KPI / Points d'attention / analyse fiorensic en cours / etc ) o Organise et anime un point mensuel de revue de l'activité (CO-PIL : KPI mensuels / Disponibilité & Perfs / Points Si vous pensez avoir le profil idéal et que la mission vous intéresse, n'hésitez pas à me faire parvenir votre CV. Merci d'avance, Cordialement, Victor

job_title: Administrateur base de donnée H/F issy les moulineaux
job_summary:
Description de l'entreprise


 Capgemini est un leader mondial du conseil, des services informatiques et de la transformation numérique. A la pointe de l’innovation, le Groupe aide ses clients à saisir l’ensemble des opportunités que présentent le cloud, le digital et les plateformes. Fort de 50 ans d’expérience et d’une grande expertise des différents secteurs d’activité, il accompagne les entreprises et organisations dans la réalisation de leurs ambitions, de la définition de leur stratégie à la mise en oeuvre de leurs opérations.
 Pour Capgemini, ce sont les hommes et les femmes qui donnent toute sa valeur à la technologie. Résolument multiculturel, le Groupe compte plus de 325 000 collaborateurs présents dans plus de 55 pays. Il a réalisé un chiffre d'affaires de 18,1 milliards d'euros en 2021.
 Plus d’informations sur www.capgemini.com. People matter, results count.




 Description de la mission


 En tant qu'alternant informaticien et au coeur de la Direction Sûreté vous participerez aux outils de gouvernance de la protection d’une centaine de bâtiments en France. Vous serez en tant qu'alternant employé(e) au Security Command Center qui supervise tous les dispositifs de contrôle d’accès, de détection d’intrusion et de vidéo surveillance.
 Vous rejoindrez une équipe de 15 personnes basée à Issy Les Moulineaux (à moins de 10 minutes des transports RER C, Trame T2 et métros ligne 12 et ligne 8).
 Vos missions pendant votre alternance se composeront entre autre de:

 Développer un Système de Gestion de Base de Données (SGBD) à partir du Security Inventory (Tableau Excel qui regroupe toutes les données sûreté de tous les sites de France).
 Développer les outils de reporting de la Direction Sûreté.
 Contribuer à l’administration des deux bases de données de la gestion des accès (OnGuard et Micro-Sésame).
 Contribuer à l’administration des espaces partagés sur Microsoft Teams.
 Travailler en forte collaboration avec le Group IT en Inde





 Profil


 En tant qu'alternant vous disposez de ces compétences:

 Maîtrise des langages SGBD (par exemple MySQL) 
Microsoft Office / Power BI / VBA et des macros Excel
 Maitrise de Teams 
Bon niveau d’anglais
 Notion de gestion d’un projet avec la méthode Agile

 De plus vous avez à coeur:

 Rigueur et discrétion (données confidentielles et personnelles)
 Capacité d’intégration et d’écoute
 Appétence pour la Cyber sécurité
 Esprit d’équipe

 CAPGEMINI, Entreprise handi accueillante, conformément à la norme AFNOR NF X50-783, est également signataire de la charte de la diversité en entreprise.

Company Description
  Ubisoft’s 20,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come.
 Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves.
 If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.



 Job Description
  As a Vulnerability Management Technical Program Manager you will support the day-to-day vulnerability mitigation activities as well as efforts to implement best practice methods, processes, tools and drive continuous improvement initiatives at Ubisoft. You will be joining Ubisoft within the Security & Risk Management Team – SRM, which is a global team across Europe, Asia and the Americas. SRM’s scope covers different spheres of security from our games, to securing our cloud environments to making sure are employees use our technological environments safely.
 More precisely, in this role, you'll act as the main point of contact and facilitator for vulnerability management within Ubisoft’s SRM group. Acting as a bridge between SRM and Ubisoft as a whole, you’ll need to present insightful results in simple, yet, effective business terms. As part of your mission, you will follow up on security assessments, coordinate security patching, assist vulnerability management, help minimize attack surface area, and recommend corrective actions.
 As part of this team, topics you will work on will include cloud environments, network architecture, security audits, developing policies and security patch management. We don't expect you to know all this, but you'll be able to ramp up on these technologies as well as many others.
 Join us and empower SRM to remain a world-class reference for the entire gaming industry!
 Your role:
 In partnership with business teams, IT and Uplay team, the Technical Project Manager will work closely with product owners, development, design, and testing team to deliver websites and interfaces for the Ubisoft’s subscription service and provide engaging experience to the players around the world. The Technical project manager’s role is to manage the development, scoping, growth, roadmap, tracking and communication across various stakeholders. The technical Project Manager will ensure that the Subscription program objectives are achieved through successfully executing and tracking agreed initiatives in coordination with IT and Business teams.
 Your mission will be as below:

 Manage the end-to-end workflow for handling and responding to vulnerability reports, from Red/Blue Teams and scanning technologies while working with IT engineering and gaming studio organizations
 Collaborates with infrastructure and application owners on security hot-fixes or patch management validation
 Generate remediation action plans and corresponding tickets for system and application owners to remediate identified flaws
 Collaborate with system and application owners through the remediation lifecycle
 Develop periodic reports on the discovery and closure of vulnerabilities to maintain stakeholder accountability
 Supports the cyber incident response team in specified vulnerability discovery and identification tasks during crisis management
 Assist in documenting standard operating procedures
 Stays abreast of current and emerging Vulnerability intelligence to communicate and prioritize risk to internal stakeholders.
 Serve as the authority for the platform and metrics reporting.
 Lead the management and maintenance of patch management platforms/tools, including troubleshooting.




 Qualifications
  Background 

A 1st significative experience leading large enterprise security remediation activities
 Familiarity with security standards and fundamentals such as OWASP Top 10, CVSS, CVE
 Demonstrated experience, certifications and education in Cyber Security, auditing and/or consulting;
 Ability to interact with representatives from different sectors and communicate technical and business concepts to all types of audiences through different ways – presentations, documentation, communication;
 The ability to qualify risks factors in a large enterprise with thousands of servers, new technologies and a diverse ecosystem while understanding the business context;
 Experience in DevSecOps, Blue/Red Teaming would be an asset;
 Ability to make decisions quickly in a constantly changing environment and demonstrate a capacity for innovation;

 Additional Information
  Ubisoft Advantages
 Profit sharing, company saving plan. 25 Paid Holidays, 12 additional days off, 50% of your transportation subscription, luncheon voucher, health insurance + special Ubisoft advantages
 Our headquarter is in Saint-Mandé (line 1, “Saint-Mandé” stop), Gym inside our office, remote friendly company

 Complementary information
 Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability status. All information will be treated as confidential in accordance with the Employment Equity Act.

The vente-privee group has consolidated its various European brands, together made up of 6000 employees, under one unified conglomerate: Veepee. This coalescence marks a new chapter in its European history.
  


 With Privalia, vente-exclusive, Designer & Friends, Zlotewyprzedaze, Eboutic and vente-privee, Veepee achieved a 3.7 billion Euro turnover as of 2018. Present in 14 countries now, Veepee is taking a leading role in the European digital commerce landscape.
  


 Our 6000 employees have chosen a job at Veepee to spice up their daily lives! Our teams implement new technologies to fuel our strategies, offering our customers the best possible experience.
  


 Are you eager to learn? Veepee offers you a variety of trades to develop your career, enabling you to renew your skills constantly. Tech, logistics, sales, marketing, sales production: join us on an exciting, digital-centered journey.
  


 We are looking for a Data Extraction Expert to join the Data Extraction team of the Veepee Sourcing Department.
  


 The Veepee group is currently acquiring tools to work on the subject of pricing. These pricing tools must be fed continuously with reliable and exhaustive data, in particular by extracting information from websites. Each site extraction must be configured and supervised by an operator or "Data extraction expert", and this tool allows him to manage multiple extractions at the same time.
   




   The Data Extraction Expert will aim to configure and supervise a set of website extractions, on a recurring basis. It is the basis of the data value chain.
  



Responsibilities



 Configuration of extractions:


 Sharing of the "backlog" of configurations to be carried out, in connection with other Data Extraction Experts of the team and the team manager;

 Continuous configuration of new extractions on the internal tool.


 Continuous data extraction:

 Autonomous and daily management of a set of extractions;

 Proactive identification and correction of various errors.


 Training and knowledge sharing 


Proposed improvements to be implemented on the scrap and IA interface to continuously improve operations: UX/UI, error management;

 Training of new Data Extraction Experts;

 Mutual assistance within the team in the event of peak load;

 Sharing of expertise accumulated during configurations and extractions.






About you


 You ideally have BAC+5 type Engineer / developer training 
2+ years of professional experience 
Strong appetite for coding (HTML/CSS/JavaScript/REGEX/XPATH, XHR/XML queries)
 Fluency in both English and French (written & oral)
 Proficiency in HTML/ CSS
 Mastery of JavaScript languages (ability to write scripts)








 Plus points


 Cyber Security knowledge
 Agile methodologies 






Location


 This position is based in our headquarters (Wilson Campus) in La Plaine Saint-Denis, France






   Please note that you must have valid work permit which allows you to work in France or EU region.
   




   Belonging to Veepee, 
   <vpTech/> is one of the biggest tech communities in Europe with more than 800 IT collaborators.
  


 From 
   Warsaw to 
   Barcelona, through 
   Lyon, 
   Nantes, 
   Tel Aviv, 
   Brussels,
    Nice,
Amsterdam, and 
   Paris, all our projects are developed in a functional environment with a wide skills variety where you’ll be sure to find your place, no matter the technology you want to work with.
  


 If you love to try things why don’t you jump on this new adventure?

Overall Purpose of Role


The Cyber & Information Security Officer directly supports the Monaco Private Bank and Monaco Barclays Private Asset Management businesses with responsibilities for managing the Data Leakage Prevention (DLP) platform, oversight of the Cyber & information risk control environment, influencing/driving associated remediation programmes including adherence to the Group Cyber Policy and Control Framework, and providing advice/challenge to the business in respect of tactical solutions and strategic programmes. The Cyber & Information Security Officer also supports the BU’s Cyber regulatory engagement and the local implementation of controls related to client confidentiality as mandated by the local regulator.
The Cyber & Information Security Officer reports into the Cyber & Information Security Manager (Monaco).



Key specific accountabilities


Data Loss Prevention:



Coordinate the implementation and improvement of the local Data Loss Prevention platforms. Support, document and implement the design of data loss prevention policies, ensuring coverage of confidential data monitoring in conjunction with business risks and in line with the information risk process and standards. Ensure application maintenance (i.e. upgrades, certificates compliancy, reporting)
Maintain the DLP controls in line with the BU appetite. Identify data loss events and coordinate escalation and remediation plan with key stakeholders.
Ensure appropriate controls around information classification and handling are delivered.



Risk assurance:



Ensure risks arising from changes and new projects are properly identified, assessed and managed. Provide project support, assurance, remediation support, and guidance to the business. Assist the business with identifying alternate solutions or compensating controls where requirements are not met, or provide guidance for appropriate risk acceptance.
Provide subject matter expertise (SME) and direction to strategic projects and business initiatives as required, including Information Security sign-off when required.
Ensure any risk issues or events related to information security is recorded in a timely manner and properly escalated to relevant stakeholders. Define relevant action plan and ensure all actions are tracked and completed successfully.
Provide guidance to the business around fraud prevention and ensure any fraud attempt is managed and recorded



Logical Access Management:



Ensure privileged accounts are properly monitored and controlled and execute the Privileged Access controls to prevent any unauthorized access to clients’ data.
Ensure any access to Monaco systems is compliant with the Identity and Access Management Standard, Role Based Access Control framework and need-to-know principle.



Cyber Risk Management:



Execute and continuously enhance the Cyber control plan following the group standards.
Implement the BU Cyber program, ensuring delivery of the proposed control environment.
Drive the local delivery of global cyber projects and the local remediation of large-scale cyber issues identified by Group security teams.
Ensure security threats, vulnerabilities, non-compliance and risks specific to the BU are properly followed-up, escalated and remediated. 
Identify and manage BU specific cyber and information security requirements including championing into the CSO demand.
Understand importance of cyber to clients and embed cyber in client and colleague environment.
Partner with Chief Security Office (CSO) strategy and architecture to ensure security strategy meets Group and local Business Unit (BU) requirements.
Partner with Group and other BU’s stakeholder to ensure Cyber projects are properly and consistently driven.
Ensure awareness and provide guidance and trainings to the business around Cyber Risks.



Regulatory:



Provide expertise to the Compliance Advisory team as part of the compliance to the data protection authority requirements, and participate to the authorizations requests redaction.
Ensure Business Unit/ Geographical regulatory obligations are met.
Define and drive a roadmap to ensure compliance with the AMSN requirements.
Ensure standard and appropriate responses to regulatory bodies.
Be a referent for questions related to Cyber regulatory obligations and Data Privacy and provide guidance to the Business to comply with these regulations.



Governance:



Lead and organise the Cyber and Information Security Forum.
Develop working relationships with the Barclays Private Bank business and risk and control teams/colleagues to ensure information risks are effectively managed.
Ensure local procedures are properly drafted and maintained.
Drive training and awareness through the technology and business teams.





As an organisation, Barclays have agreed a single cross-business Purpose for Barclays, and five core Values which underpin it. Our Purpose is helping people achieve their ambitions in the right way. Put simply this is the answer to the question ‘What is Barclays for?’ and it should guide our every action as employees.






RESPECT
Respect means respecting and valuing those we work with – our colleagues and other partners. It is about building trust and promoting collaboration.
INTEGRITY
Integrity demands we act fairly, ethically and honestly. This requires us to have the courage always to do the right thing, never tolerating the wrong thing, and to be accountable for our decisions.
SERVICE
Service means ensuring our clients and customers are always uppermost in our minds. We must strive to exceed their expectations so we automatically become their ‘Go-To’ bank. 
EXCELLENCE
Excellence calls on us to use all our energy, skills and resources to deliver great service for our customers and clients and outstanding sustainable results for shareholders. 
STEWARDSHIP
Stewardship is about being determined to leave things better than we found them, so we constantly strive to improve the way we operate as an organisation and the impact we have on society.

Risk&Co est la seule entreprise française de sûreté capable de proposer une offre complète de services d’accompagnement sur les risques cyber, sûreté et sécurité, en France et à l’international à une clientèle de grands comptes (acteurs du CAC40, OIV), de gouvernements et d’institutions internationales.


 Mission proposée :
 Afin de répondre à une demande toujours plus soutenue, l’équipe « Rétroconception » de Risk&Co recherche de nouveaux collaborateurs pour travailler sur des sujets relatifs aux systèmes Android, avec notamment la production de preuves de concept originales illustrant des vulnérabilités mises en évidence lors d’audits.
 Composante d’une large zone d’intervention, ce domaine de spécialisation reflète une certaine prise avec l’actualité : les téléphones mobiles représentent un vecteur qu’il convient impérativement d’intégrer lors de l’étude d’une surface d’attaque.
 Si les temps des missions sont relativement longs et permettent un investissement durable dans la thématique, les attentes sont importantes et exigeantes : l’objectif est de maîtriser une pile logicielle entière, de la couche utilisateur jusqu’aux profondeurs de l’assembleur.


 Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
 Rejoindre la BU Cybersécurité de Risk&Co, c’est :

Travailler sur des projets passionnants pour des clients prestigieux issus de secteurs critiques comme l’industrie et la défense, et répondre ainsi aux attentes techniques et opérationnelles les plus pointues où la cybersécurité rejoint la sécurité nationale, la sécurité des populations et la souveraineté. Vous aurez un réel impact et pourrez mesurer les effets de votre travail en environnement réel.
Intégrer une équipe soudée et riche de nombreuses compétences, valorisant l’excellence technique et l’intérêt des sujets. Vous prendrez part à des projets de haut niveau au sein d’un groupe dynamique, où les cadres dirigeants sont accessibles. Selon votre intérêt, vous pourrez également développer des compétences cyber sur nos autres métiers.
Évoluer dans un environnement privilégiant le travail en équipe, le binôme et le mentorat, et encourageant chacun à tirer parti de l’expérience de l’ensemble de ses collaborateurs. Selon votre profil et votre expérience, vous pourrez également prendre des responsabilités techniques et/ou managériales.



 Profil recherché

Vous maîtrisez la manipulation d’outils d’analyse dynamique (Frida, Windbg, x64dbg, etc…)
Vous avez une connaissance du fonctionnement d’un système Android
Vous savez manipuler des outils d’analyse statique (IDA, Ghidra, etc…)
Vous avez une maîtrise de conception d’outillages en Python
Vous participez à des challenges en ligne (CTF, Root Me)
Vous êtes doté d’une bonne capacité rédactionnelle et appréciez le travail en équipe
Vous disposez d’un très bon niveau de communication orale et écrite, tant en français qu’en anglais



 Quelques compétences appréciées :

Vous avez idéalement des connaissances sur le noyau Linux : fonctionnement, exploitation, etc…
Vous avez une expérimentation dans le domaine du fuzzing
Vous avez une inscription officielle de CVE (Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures)
Vous faites une veille régulière dans le domaine de la Cybersécurité



 Rémunération : selon profil et expérience
 Merci de bien vouloir adresser votre candidature (CV) à : recrutements@riskeco.com

Paris, France 
2900774 




Job Description 

Role Purpose
 The purpose of this role is to analyse, identify, rectify &recommend specific improvement measures that help in the securityposture of the organization by protecting the sensitive information

 Do



 Ensuring customer centricity by providing aptcybersecurity 


Monitoring and safeguarding the log sources and security access


 Planning for disaster recovery in the event of any securitybreaches


 Monitor for attacks, intrusions and unusual, unauthorized orillegal activity


 Performs moderately complex log reviews and forensic analysis toidentify unauthorized or unacceptable access to data or systems


 Conduct security assessments, risk analysis and root causeanalysis of security incidents


 Handling incidents escalated by the L1 team in 24x7 rotationalshifts


 Use advanced analytics tools to determine emerging threatpatterns and vulnerabilities


 Completing all tactical security operations tasks associatedwith this engagement.


 Analyses all the attacks and come up with remedial attackanalysis


 Conduct detailed analysis of incidents and create reports anddashboards







 Stakeholder coordination & audit assistance


 Liaise with stakeholders in relation to cyber security issuesand provide future recommendations


 Maintain an information security risk register and assist withinternal and external audits relating to information security


 Assist with the creation, maintenance and delivery of cybersecurity awareness training for colleagues


 Advice and guidance to employees on issues such as spam andunwanted or malicious emails





 Stakeholder Interaction



 Stakeholder Type
 Stakeholder Identification
 Purpose of Interaction


 Internal
 Technical Lead/ Project Lead
 Regular reporting & updates


 Security Intelligence (Practice)
 Coordination for security reasons


 External

 Customer


 To coordinate for all security breaches & resolutions



 Display

WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT OUR BIG TECH TRANSFORMATION?

 L’Oréal is present in 130 countries on five continents. For more than a century, L’Oréal has devoted itself solely to one business: beauty; it is now the industry world leader with €29 billion consolidated sales.
 Today, L’Oréal includes 1700 tech positions and it’s constantly growing. Especially with our ambition to become the #1 BeautyTech company, meaning inventing the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.
 BeautyTech will equip the Group with the key assets it needs to conquer this new world, where Tech has become strategic.
 To achieve this ambition, L’Oréal needs to continue recruiting diverse, innovative, skilled and passionate minds in different tech domains such as Data, Digital, Cloud, Cyber Security, IT Architecture, DevOps, Applications and Infrastructure.

 HOLD ON, WHERE ARE OUR MANNERS?
 WE HAVEN’T PRESENTED OUR TEAM !
 We are called “NEO”
 NEO is a highly multicultural team composed of 170 people coming from all L'Oréal countries and divisions. The ambition of NEO project is to enable the Beauty Tech Transformation of L'Oréal, by harmonizing data & processes with One global ERP Core, based on SAP S/4 Hana technology.
 NEO aims at redefining the ways of working of the group, through end-to-end processes that are multi-métiers (supply-chain, manufacturing, purchasing, finance...), following an agile methodology.

 INTERESTED?
 THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL DO IN NUTSHELL!

 The project will be rolled out in several countries. One of the main phases of the project roll out is the “deployment phase”. This phase contains several activities involving local teams (L’Oréal countries), for example: end user trainings, Users Acceptance Tests…

 As part of Data migration team, you will specifically work on Data Quality topic.
 We can summarize your missions in 3 main objectives:

 1. Mission 1: To provide to the Métier a Data quality check tool ready to use


 You will make sure that Métiers have provided clear, reliable, relevant data cleansing rules
 You will then set up the tool based on provided rules
 You will make sure the tool works properly and if needed raise ticket to Accenture team



 Mission 2: To publish a dashboard on KPI on a regular basis
 You will prepare PBI dashboard and work with tech team to improve PBI automatization
 You will share reports to relevant team


 3. Mission 3: To ensure the data quality is improving

 You will monitor the defect assignation
 You will facilitate regular meeting with Métier (local and central) to monitor the defect resolution, enrich IDQ with new rules..
 You will prioritize cleansing based on Data migration expectation


 STILL INTERESTED?
 THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED!

 First and foremost, we love people that are curious, collaborative, eager to have an impact and who value innovation, autonomy and team spirit.
 In this position good communication and level of English is key, as you will be working with many different stakeholders, in a multicultural context. A second foreign language will be an advantage.
 Secondly, in this specific position, it will be important for you to have excellent organizational and analytical skills and a good management of Office tools (Outlook, Teams, PowerPoint, Excel..). A first experience with ServiceNow and/or PowerBI is a nice to have (not mandatory).
 Finally, we would favor a profile in Engineering or Business studies in Master 2 with at least one experience in internship/Apprenticeship in another company.

 WAIT, THERE IS MORE! LET US GIVE YOU 4 OTHER REASONS TO JOIN US!

 Joining L'Oréal means joining a company that:


 Invests in Tech and positions its Tech teams at the heart of its digital transformation strategy.
 Allows its employees to have a real impact, to test their ideas, to innovate and to build our future.
 Has a powerful and innovative HR policy: a very dynamic mobility policy, significant investment in employee training, regular re-evaluation of remuneration, numerous innovative HR measures: Time Savings Account, paternity leave, Citizen Day, etc.
 Has chosen to uphold strong values and to be particularly advanced from a social and environmental point of view (strong diversity and inclusion policy, L'Oréal for the Future program, commitment to numerous communities, etc.).

 The L'Oréal Group is convinced that difference is a deep source of wealth, that allows everyone to grow, to challenge themselves and to go further.
 We strongly encourage everyone to always dare and never censor themselves. Skills can always be learnt.
 We will be delighted to exchange with you!
 Ready to build the future of L'Oréal together? Apply now!

 YOU APPLIED?
 THIS WHAT HAPPENS NEXT…

 You will receive an answer within 2 weeks of applying.
 If your CV is selected, you will have an HR interview with Fanny, our tech recruiter.
 Lastly, there will be a technical interview with your potential manager (sometimes accompanied by another team member).

 If we are unable to move forward with your application, you can expect to receive a prompt answer in one week with constructive feedback. We strongly value the time and energy you invest in us.

 YOU WANT FURTHER INFORMATIONS?
 CHECK THESE USEFUL LINKS:

 Know more about BeautyTech @L'Oréal
 Know more about L'Oréal news
 L’Oréal in key figures
 Know more about CSR @L’Oréal
 Know more about L’Oréal for the Future program.

Axione est l'acteur de référence du secteur des infrastructures télécoms fixes et mobiles. Au sein des Groupes Bouygues et BPCE, Axione réalise en 2021 un chiffre d'affaires de 650 millions d'euros. 

 L'entreprise accompagne ses clients publics (collectivités territoriales) et privés (opérateurs télécoms, grands comptes, équipementiers…) dans leur stratégie numérique. 

 Ce sont plus de 2900 femmes et hommes qui apportent chaque jour leurs savoir-faire nécessaires à la conception, construction, exploitation et commercialisation des réseaux d'aujourd'hui et de demain. 

 Vous souhaitez animer le monde avec nous ? Venez apporter votre pierre à l'édifice en exprimant vos talents ! 

 Au sein de la Digital Factory d'Axione, le cyber security analyst protège les SI et les réseaux exploités par Axione contre les cyberattaques internes et externes pour préserver leur disponibilité et assurer la pérennité de l’activité de l’entreprise. Il est garant de la bonne application de la politique de sécurité du SI. 

 Rattaché(e) au Responsable de la Sécurité des Systèmes d'Information d'Axione, vos principales missions seront les suivantes : 

 1/ Détecter les risques de cybersécurité 



Enrichir la collecte et la normalisation des évènements SI et réseaux à traiter par le SOC (Security Operation Center)
Mettre en place et analyser des scans récurrents sur le SI
Mettre en œuvre les outils de détection automatique de vulnérabilité
 2/ Traiter les risques de cybersécurité 



Investiguer les vulnérabilités remontées par les scans et les audits et des incidents remontés par le SOC
Corriger les vulnérabilités
Tracer les incidents de sécurité et formaliser des retours d’expérience
 3/ Appliquer et contrôler le respect de la politique cybersécurité 



Déclencher et vérifier la prise en compte des exigences de sécurité dans les projets SI
Réaliser les ouvertures, fermetures et revues des flux entre les zones du SI et l’extérieur
Traiter et suivre les demandes de dérogations
Identifier et appliquer les correctifs de sécurité sur les composants du SI
Gérer les profils d’accès VPN
Réaliser périodiquement les revues des comptes à privilège
 4/ Faire de la veille sécurité SI 



Tester les outils orientés cybersécurité
Être à l’écoute des nouveaux modes de cyberattaque
Mettre en œuvre les projets de la roadmap du plan cyberdéfense
 De formation supérieure BAC +5 avec une spécialisation en sécurité des SI/Cybersécurité, vous justifiez d'une expérience significative (8/10 ans) sur un poste similaire. 


Compétences techniques requises :


Applicatifs informatiques techniques et OS (windows et linux)
Analyse des risques induits par un changement, programmation (scripting, requêtes sql, langages évolués)
Protocoles (IP, DNS, SSH, FTP, DHCP, SNMP, …)
Administration d’équipements d’infrastructure SI (Pare feu, proxy, R-proxy, VPN…)
Annuaires (LDAP, Active Directory)
 Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour vos qualités à travailler en équipe et en transverse. Vous êtes pugnace, rigoureux(se), organisé(e) et autonome. 

 Passionné(e) par la "cyber", vous êtes adaptable et vous prenez des initiatives.

Créateur de l’hypermarché et pionnier de la consommation de masse, Carrefour reste fidèle à ses racines mais se réinvente pour permettre à chacun, chaque jour, de manger mieux : plus sain, plus local, plus responsable.
Nos atouts pour y parvenir ? Un réseau multiformat de + 5 400 magasins, la création de services et d'une offre digitale de référence, une coopération renforcée avec les acteurs du monde agricole, de la chaîne alimentaire, de la Tech...
Et des collaborateurs passionnés, qui s’engagent, challengent leur métier et grandissent ensemble pour réussir la transition alimentaire pour tous.
Porteuse de cette ambition, la Direction DSI recrute un(e) :


Stagiaire - Cyber Security Analyst (H/F)


Mission générale :


Le stagiaire sera rattaché à l'entité projet au sein de la "Plateforme Services et Opérations". La PSO fournit et opère tous les services d'infrastructure pour l'ensemble des métiers Carrefour (supply, magasin, finance/rh, marchandise, etc.). Il intégrera l'équipe "Sécurisation Active Directory".
Le futur stagiaire travaillera dans l'équipe du projet "Sécurisation Active Directory" en contexte international (12 pays)
Dans ce cadre, vous serez amené à :

Déterminer les indicateurs de suivi du niveau sécurité des Active Directory pays
Déterminer des indicateurs de performance projet de sécurisation
Construire les tableaux de bord automatisés associés à ces indicateurs
Assister l'équipe projet aux activités de sécurisation de l'Active Directory (migration de comptes, liste de remediations de sécurité et implémentation, etc.)


 
Votre profil :


Vous préparez un diplôme de niveau BAC +3 à 5, en école de commerce, d’ingénieurs ou université spécialisé en Ingénieur en Informatique, Cybersécurité.
Idéalement, vous avez une première expérience en grande distribution ou en lien avec les biens de grande consommation.
Vous êtes autonome, rigoureux et vous avez un bon sens du relationnel.
Vous êtes convaincant et vous savez faire adhérer votre auditoire à un projet.
Vous savez présenter de manière synthétique.
Vous maîtrisez les outils du pack Office (Excel et Powerpoint notamment).


Informations complémentaires :


Lieu : Lyon ou Massy (5 min. du RER B/C).
Vous aurez accès aux infrastructures du campus (salle de sport, conciergerie, drive, parking…).
Vous aurez accès à un large choix de restaurations.


Envie de tenter l'aventure ?
Envoyez-nous votre lettre de motivation et votre CV en précisant la date de début de stage souhaitée.

SonicWall delivers Boundless Cybersecurity for the hyper-distributed era in a work reality where everyone is remote, mobile, and unsecure. SonicWall safeguards organizations mobilizing for their new business normal with seamless protection that stops the most evasive cyberattacks across boundless exposure points and increasingly remote, mobile, and cloud-enabled workforces. By knowing the unknown, providing real-time visibility and enabling breakthrough economics, SonicWall closes the cybersecurity business gap for enterprises, governments and SMBs worldwide. For more information, visit https://www.sonicwall.com/ or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram. Ready to do your part in the cyber arms race? SonicWall offers fun, high-energy work environments at the leading edge of technology, networking, and cybersecurity. Whether you're in sales, marketing, engineering, product management, technical support, or finance, you'll have real opportunities to help protect more than 500,000 organizations across the globe. If you're ready for a career that can impact change — and not just another job — join one of committed and enthusiastic SonicWall teams in offices around the world.
 Job Responsibilities:

Discover, Qualify, Validate & Design a solution that meets the customer's requirements, the customer's environment and within their budget parameters.
Demonstrate the merits of the solution and lead a demo, proof of concept, aligned to the customer needs.
Work in partnership with sales to achieve the technical win and business win.
Build a trusted relationship with the technical decision makers internally and externally.
Technical enabler for customers and partners.
Voice of the customer back to product management and engineering.
Act as a technical champion, evangelist to drive pipeline development and brand awareness through publishing whitepapers, webinars, speaking events.

Required Qualification:

3+ years of successful pre-sales, technical consulting or systems engineering experience in network security industry.
3+ years designing network and/or system security solutions.
Firewall knowledge and customer demonstrations.
Working knowledge or Hybrid and Cloud computing.
B.S. degree in Computer Science or related field.
Current CISSP, CEH, Comptia Security+ or similar.
Excellent presentation skills.
Understanding of IPv4, IPv6, networking, routing, switching, DNS, and Virtual Private Networks.
Understanding of SSL/TLS, PKI, signing and encryption.
Understanding of network security including Firewall, IDS, IPS, DDOS, and Anti-Virus technology.
Good understanding of LDAP, Radius, Microsoft Active Directory, and other AAA.
Hands-on experience with operating systems including Linux, Windows, and OSX.
Knowledge of network management tools that utilize SNMP, NetFlow, or equivalent.
Comfortable to work with C-Level at the customer.
Organized and analytical, able to eliminate sales obstacles through creative and adaptive approaches.

    Rattaché(e) au Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) / Responsable de la Continuité d’Activité (RPCA) au sein de la Direction Risques, Conformité et Contrôle Permanent.
